snippet: New York City’s parks department lost 45 percent of its members after it doubled its prices a year and a half ago, losing about $200,000 instead of making $4 million in new revenue.
abstract: New York City's parks department is trying to remedy 45 percent drop in paid memberships at its public recreation centers since fees were doubled in 2011; officials say they will offer new lower-priced membership categories for members aged 18 to 24, among other measures aimed at restoring membership levels.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s parks department lost 45 percent of its members after it doubled its prices a year and a half ago, losing about $200,000 instead of making $4 million in new revenue.

headline.seo: Parks Re-evaluating After Losing Memberships to Fee Increase
headline.main: Public Recreation Centers Looking to Stem Exodus
headline.print_headline: Public Recreation Centers Looking to Stem Exodus
